Description: Five rejoined fragments from the side of a glazed composition pilgrim-bottle of the type of the New Year's flasks, decorated with a collar design alternating rows of very varied patterns (from bottom to top : raindrop-shaped beads, lotus flowers, triangular pattern, rosettes, vertical lines, vegetal plait) separated by double or triple curved lines. The incisions are coloured with a brown glaze. A tiny part of the raised band around the edge is preserved at the right end.
Curator's comments: One of the "many varieties of 'pilgrim bottles' of green or yellow paste, with necks of lotus and palm patterns, some very graceful, and wreathed around the body with very varied patterns" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 75 § 72. See also other fragments Boston, MFA, RES.87.146.a-h. See also London, BM, EA 21779, 21780, 21781, 21782, 23755, 23756, 55345, 55346, Bolton, 1886.28.23.a and b and Boston, MFA, RES.87.146.a-h.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 75 § 72)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.52, p.53, p.174, pl.16)
